project.name: WLJ Finance Module
project.description: Design and implement a secure, AI-driven personal finance module within Whole Life Journey (WLJ) that supports accounts, budgeting, goals, metrics, bank connectivity, and AI interpretation while meeting high security and audit standards.

tasks.name: Define Finance Module Scope and Core Concepts

description.objective: Establish a clear and shared definition of what the WLJ Finance Module includes and how it fits into the broader WLJ ecosystem.
actions: Define supported financial account types (checking, savings, credit cards, loans, investments).
Define core finance concepts: accounts, transactions, categories, budgets, goals, metrics.
Document how finance data links to WLJ goals, tasks, and reflections.
Define what is in-scope and explicitly out-of-scope for the initial release.
description.output: A written Finance Module Scope document defining concepts, boundaries, and integration points with WLJ.

description.objective: Create a normalized, secure data structure that supports finance tracking, AI analysis, and future bank integrations.
actions: Define database tables for accounts, transactions, categories, budgets, goals, and metrics.
Define relationships between users, households, and financial entities.
Identify which fields are sensitive and require encryption at rest.
Document retention rules for financial data.
description.output: Approved database schema for the WLJ Finance Module with security annotations.

tasks.name: Implement Manual Account and Transaction Management

description.objective: Allow users to gain value from the Finance Module before bank connections are enabled.
actions: Build UI to manually create and edit financial accounts.
Enable manual entry of transactions.
Support basic categorization of transactions.
Ensure all actions are logged for audit purposes.
description.output: Users can manually manage accounts and transactions inside WLJ.

description.objective: Help users plan and control spending while tracking progress toward financial goals.
actions: Implement monthly budgets by category.
Create financial goal types (savings, debt payoff, giving, major purchases).
Calculate progress toward each goal in real time.
Display simple visual indicators (on-track, warning, off-track).
description.output: Budgeting and financial goals are fully functional and visible on the WLJ dashboard.

description.objective: Provide clear, understandable financial insights at a glance.
actions: Calculate cash flow, net worth, savings rate, and debt balances.
Design a finance dashboard showing trends over time.
Allow filtering by date range and account group.
Ensure calculations are deterministic and reproducible.
description.output: A finance dashboard that summarizes financial health using clear metrics.

description.objective: Establish safe, explainable AI behavior for interpreting financial data.
actions: Define what financial data AI is allowed to access.
Specify allowed AI outputs (summaries, trends, suggestions).
Prohibit AI from exposing raw credentials or tokens.
Document explainability requirements for AI insights.
description.output: AI Finance Interpretation Rules documented and approved.

tasks.name: Implement AI Spending Insights and Coaching

description.objective: Turn financial data into actionable guidance for users.
actions: Generate spending summaries and trend analysis.
Detect unusual or out-of-pattern spending.
Identify recurring subscriptions and potential waste.
Provide next-step recommendations tied to WLJ goals.
description.output: AI-generated financial insights visible to users with clear reasoning.

description.objective: Prepare WLJ for secure connections to external financial institutions.
actions: Select a financial data aggregator strategy.
Define token storage and refresh mechanisms.
Design sync schedules and failure handling.
Document how users connect and disconnect institutions.
description.output: A complete bank integration architecture document.

description.objective: Enable users to securely link bank and credit accounts to WLJ.
actions: Implement secure connection flow using the aggregator UI.
Store access tokens securely and encrypted.
Sync balances and transactions on a scheduled basis.
Provide clear user feedback on connection status.
description.output: Users can connect financial institutions and see synced data in WLJ.

description.objective: Protect financial data against unauthorized access and misuse.
actions: Encrypt sensitive data at rest and in transit.
Enforce role-based access controls.
Implement audit logging for all finance-related actions.
Add multi-factor authentication requirements for finance access.
description.output: Finance Module meets defined security and audit requirements.

description.objective: Ensure correctness, security, and reliability of the Finance Module.
actions: Test financial calculations for accuracy.
Validate AI outputs against defined rules.
Perform security and permission testing.
Document findings and remediation steps.
description.output: Test report confirming the Finance Module is production-ready.
